pullRequest.title: Issue 4793: TableSegment Offset-Conditional Update
pullRequest.bodyText:
Change log description

Extends the logic of removeTableKeys and updateTableEntries to allow for conditional (conditioned on a matching TableSegment offset) appends.

Purpose of the change

Closes #4793
Alongside PR: #4867, this should conclude #4677.

What the code does

Adds table segment offset checks in PravegaRequestProcessor to both it's removeTableKeys and updateTableEntries methods. These checks allow these operations to conditonally complete based on whether the provided tableSegmentOffset matches the expected offset.
It first parses the tableSegmentOffset from the request(s), compares its value and controls program flow based on this comparison.

How to verify it
(Optional: steps to verify that the changes are effective)

Run the PravegaRequestProcessorTests:

This PR only makes changes at the PravegaRequestProcessor level. Therefore it is sufficient to only test whether the new code paths are executed given the appropriate conditions.

commit.message:
Update K8 client APIs to use their 5.0.0 counterparts.

Signed-off-by: co-jo <colin.hryniowski@dell.com>

Signed-off-by: co-jo <colin.hryniowski@dell.com>

Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/pravega/pravega

Signed-off-by: co-jo <colin.hryniowski@dell.com>

* Add conditional updates (conditioned on the length of the TableSegment) to `RemoveTableKeys` and `UpdateTableEntries` WireCommands.

Signed-off-by: co-jo <colin.hryniowski@dell.com>

nodes.bodyText:
This offset check needs to be preformed atomically with respect to this put.
As is, this code will only check the length at the time the request arrived, but it could change by the time put is processed. So the value needs to be passed into tablestore to make the update atomic.

commit.message:
* Overload DirectSegmentAccess.append to include an offset parameter.
* Overload TableStore remove/put operations to also include an offset parameter.
* Update all classes implementing those interfaces changed (above).
* Adjust some of the PravegaRequestProcessorTests.

Signed-off-by: co-jo <colin.hryniowski@dell.com>

* Fix formatting.
* Let tableSegmentOffset be inclusive of a zero value.

Signed-off-by: co-jo <colin.hryniowski@dell.com>

nodes.bodyText: Note: I'm assuming that an offset of 0 is valid.

nodes.bodyText:
add " conditioned on the Segment's Length matching an expected value".
do this for remove too.

"the actual offset" -> "the actual segment length"
change it below too.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -144,6 +145,32 @@ default int maximumValueLength() { */ CompletableFuture> put(String segmentName, List entries, Duration timeout); + /** + * Inserts new or updates existing Table Entries into the given Table Segment. + * + * @param segmentName The name of the Table Segment to insert/update the Table Entries. + * @param entries A List of {@link TableEntry} instances to insert or update. If {@link TableEntry#key} + * {@link TableKey#version hasVersion} returns true for at least one of the items in the list, + * then this will perform an atomic Conditional Update. If {@link TableEntry#key} + * {@link TableKey#version} hasVersion} returns false for ALL items in the list, then this + * will perform an Unconditional update. + * @param tableSegmentOffset The expected offset of the TableSegment used for conditional (expected matches actual) appends. + * @param timeout Timeout for the operation. + * @return A CompletableFuture that, when completed, will contain a List with the current version of the each TableEntry + * Key provided. The versions will be in the same order as the TableEntry instances provided. If the operation failed, + * the future will be failed with the causing exception. Notable exceptions: + *
    + *
  • {@link StreamSegmentNotExistsException} If the Table Segment does not exist.
    • + *
  • {@link TableKeyTooLongException} If {@link TableEntry#key} exceeds {@link #maximumKeyLength()}.
    • + *
  • {@link TableValueTooLongException} If {@link TableEntry#value} exceeds {@link #maximumValueLength()}.
    • + *
  • {@link ConditionalTableUpdateException} If {@link TableEntry#key} {@link TableKey#hasVersion() hasVersion() } is true and + * {@link TableEntry#key} {@link TableKey#version} does not match the Table Entry's Key current Table Version.
    • + *
  • {@link BadSegmentTypeException} If segmentName refers to a non-Table Segment.
    • + *
  • {@link BadOffsetException} If there is a mismatch between the provided {@param tableSegmentOffset} and the actual offset.

nodes.bodyText: "The expected length of the segment. If the current length of the Segment does not equal this value, the operation will fail with a {@link BadOffsetException}."
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -51,14 +51,34 @@
      */
     CompletableFuture<Long> append(BufferView data, Collection<AttributeUpdate> attributeUpdates, Duration timeout);
 
+    /**
+     * Appends a range of bytes at the end of the Segment and atomically updates the given attributes. The byte range
+     * will be appended as a contiguous block, however there is no guarantee of ordering between different calls to this
+     * method.
+     * @see io.pravega.segmentstore.contracts.StreamSegmentStore#append(String, BufferView, Collection, Duration)
+     *
+     * @param data             The data to add.
+     * @param attributeUpdates A Collection of Attribute-Values to set or update. May be null (which indicates no updates).
+     *                         See Notes about AttributeUpdates in the interface Javadoc.
+     * @param offset           The expected offset that the append will occur at.

nodes.bodyText:
No. Do not import this value. This code should not depend on io.pravega.shared.protocol.
Define an internal constant NO_OFFSET, set it to -1, and use it just in this class. Then in commit, invoke the appropriate API of DirectSegmentAccess based on whether you have this value or not. (actually you already make this check, so just change it to the internal value)
Remove the second part of this check. You cannot rely on the length of the segment at this point as there may be multiple operations in flight that will affect it before your operation is processed.
Invoke the appropriate DirectSegmentAccess.append method here instead of throwing this.
An offset of 0 is valid, but why are you making this change? This checks for how many bytes are available for reading from the buffer stream.

commit.message:
* Add more accurate description for parameter.

Signed-off-by: co-jo <colin.hryniowski@dell.com>

* Update offsetAcceptingMethods test because put/remove methods no longer explicitly throw a BadOffsetException.

Signed-off-by: co-jo <colin.hryniowski@dell.com>

nodes.bodyText: I was only asking you to do the conditional commit for the second case. Please bring back the if-else block and only pass the explicit offset in the else case. Do not pass tableSegmentOffset in the if case as it's just a coincidence that -1 is the "no-offset" append that is now in the Segment Store. By using the other append (non-conditional), you shield yourself from any future change in the segment store that may affect how that works.

commit.message:
* Ensure that conditional append will appends.

Signed-off-by: co-jo <colin.hryniowski@dell.com>

nodes.bodyText:
then this will perform an Unconditional update

It seems like it will still be conditional on the tableSegmentOffset

@@ -165,6 +193,29 @@ default int maximumValueLength() {
      */
     CompletableFuture<Void> remove(String segmentName, Collection<TableKey> keys, Duration timeout);
 
+    /**
+     * Removes one or more Table Keys from the given Table Segment.
+     *
+     * @param segmentName        The name of the Table Segment to remove the Keys from.
+     * @param keys               A Collection of {@link TableKey} instances to remove. If {@link TableKey#hasVersion()} returns
+     *                           true for at least one of the TableKeys in this collection, then this will perform an atomic
+     *                           Conditional Update (Removal). If {@link TableKey#hasVersion()} returns false for ALL items in
+     *                           the collection, then this will perform an Unconditional Update (Removal).
